thread.title: Ryan Gosling Explains Why He Couldn't Stop Laughing During Oscars Mix-Up
thread.title_full: Ryan Gosling Explains Why He Couldn't Stop Laughing During Oscars Mix-Up

title: Ryan Gosling Explains Why He Couldn't Stop Laughing During Oscars Mix-Up
text:
Ryan Gosling's Hotness Evolution 
As many will remember, Gosling, 36, couldn't help chuckling on stage when it was revealed that the Best Picture category actually went to Moonlight instead of his musical hit, La La Land . He and the rest of his cast and crew — including Emma Stone — awkwardly walked off stage following the historic blunder. Ryan Gosling reacts as 'Moonlight' is announced as the actual Best Picture winner at the Oscars in Los Angeles on February 26, 2017. Chris Pizzello/Invision/AP Ryan Gosling and Eva Mendes' Romance 
"What really was happening as I was watching — it was surreal anyway — I was watching people start to have this panicked reaction in the crowd, and guys were coming on with headsets, and I felt like someone had been hurt," Gosling told Adobe CMO Ann Lewnes. "I thought there was some kind of medical situation, and I had this worst-case scenario playing out in my head. And then I just heard Moonlight won, and I was so relieved that I started laughing." Ryan Gosling shares his onstage reaction when hearing that 'Moonlight' won the Best Picture Oscar during Adobe Summit 2017 on March 22, 2017, in Las Vegas. Jeff Bottari/AP Images for Adobe 
Presenters Warren Beatty and Faye Dunaway were accidentally given the wrong envelope during the live broadcast from Hollywood's Dolby Theatre. La La Land producer Jordan Horowitz cut the acceptance speech short to reveal that the Barry Jenkins–directed drama was the real winner. Celebrity Oscars PDA 
"Truthfully, I was also so thrilled that Moonlight won," Gosling added on Wednesday. "It's such a groundbreaking film, made for a million dollars, and an incredible achievement, and I’m so happy for them that they were being recognized."
